concept.title: TokenScript examples in AlphaWallet
concept.shortdesc: Meet how AlphaWallet already uses TokenScript to improve the user experience for several token.

conbody.p: The AlphaWallet team created several TokenScripts for several popular token which improve their usability tremendously. To experience it, just import a wallet holding these coins in AlphaWallet or send them to a fresh AlphaWallet account.

If you don't know DAI, you missed something. DAI is a Dollar token on Ethereum, which is not centrally managed by a bank account holding a Dollar equivalent, but by a DAO holding and trading a reserve in Ether and other token. It's one of the prime examples of the power of smart contracts.
AlphaWallet's TokenScript implementation adds two functionality to the user interface of your DAI Dollar:

ol.li: You can convert it to xDai and vice versa. This brings a powerful xDai bridge straight into your wallet. With it AlphaWallet supports the offchain scaling Ethereum badly needs.

Get your best rates to lend DAI. One of the practical differences between Dollar in your bank account and DAI Dollar is that you can use smart contracts to get an interest on your Dollar. AlphaWallet supports this by displaying the best DeFi rates for DAI Dollar.

conbody.p: This features where just mostly created as a demo. They can be broadly extended: You could bridge DAI to the OMG blockchain, create the transactions required to lend it, allow to borrow more DAI or to pay back a DAI loan and withdraw your collateral and much more.

Basically, any smart contract author can implement his Smart Contract for DAI dollar as an Action Card in the DAI TokenScript, which is currently maintained by the TokenScript team. After reviewing your pull request in the example folder it can become part of AlphaWallet.

Usually, a wallet doesn't know a DeFi app until the wallet authors manually integrated its logic. For AlphaWallet we did this too - but as an author of a DeFi app you can do it yourself and submit it to our TokenScript repository for implementation in AlphaWallet.

Our TokenScript creates customized functionalities for Compound token like cDAI or cWBTC as well a aDAI (DAI token in AAVE). If you have those coins in AlphaWallet, you can deposit more or redeem them in the wallet. AlphaWallet can also show information about the interest rates your token get.
There are also TokenScripts for other DeFis, for example for UniSwap or DDEX. But they are very rudimentary, just catching those token and adding information.
